snippet: Fourth-quarter profit declined as rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at the company’s largest newspapers could not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising.
abstract: New York Times Company reports fourth-quarter profit declined as rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at the company's largest newspapers could not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising; net income was $58.9 million, or 39 cents a share, compared with $67.1 million, or 44 cents a share, in year-ago quarter.
lead_paragraph: Fourth-quarter profit declined as rising subscription and digital advertising revenue at the company’s largest newspapers could not offset the continued drop-off in print advertising.

headline.main: Fourth-Quarter Profit and Revenue Declined at The New York Times Company
headline.print_headline: Fourth-Quarter Profit and Revenue Declined at The New York Times Company
